What kind of consent do I give when clicking "Accept all" on the UTN website?
By clicking "Accept all," you consent to data processing by DAAD and third parties where data protection may not meet EU standards. You can manage cookie preferences under the "Cookies" section.

Are there interdisciplinary programs in natural sciences at German universities?
Yes, programs like Sustainability Studies combine natural sciences (e.g., biology) with humanities (e.g., economics) to address environmental and societal challenges.

What’s the job outlook for natural science graduates in Germany?
Prospects are very good, as Germany aims to attract companies and investment, valuing interdisciplinary teamwork in these fields.

You should thrive in interdisciplinary teams, think in complex structures, and have a strong foundation in your chosen subject.

Are most natural science degrees single-subject focused?
Yes, bachelor’s programs in math, natural sciences, and computer science typically focus on one subject, though interdisciplinary options exist.

What makes Sustainability Studies unique?
It blends natural sciences (biology/geography) with social sciences (policy/ethics) to develop solutions for environmental and societal issues.

Why does Germany emphasize natural sciences?
To maintain competitiveness in attracting global companies and investments, creating strong career opportunities for graduates.
